title: Fuquay-Varina survives Holly Springs, 16-8
text:
Fuquay-Varina survives Holly Springs, 16-8 
Posted 3:42 a.m. today Your friends e-mail addresses (comma separated): * Subject: * 46 Images 
Fuquay-Varina, N.C. â€” Fuquay-Varina broke an 8-8 tie with Holly Springs in the third quarter and its defense held on in the fourth to claim a 16-8 win. 
After a scoreless first quarter, Brycen Braswell got Fuquay-Varina on the board in the second quarter with a five-yard touchdown run. The two-point conversion by Colten Smith gave the Bengals an 8-0 lead. 
Holly Springs' defense got the Golden Hawks their first points with second quarter safety, cutting the deficit to 8-2. Then Davis Ferguson broke a 10-yard run for a score, but the extra-point failed and the score was tied at 8-8. 
The 8-8 tie stood at halftime. 
Fuquay-Varina broke the tie in the third quarter. Smith ran the ball from midfield to the Holly Springs 29-yard-line. Then three plays later broke a 28-yard run for a score. He also added another two-point conversion to make it 16-8. 
Smith's touchdown ended up being the game-winning touchdown. 
Holly Springs was driving in Fuquay-Varina territory with less than one minute left, but Austin Pluckhorn intercepted a Ferguson pass with 30 seconds left to seal the Bengals win. 
Fuquay-Varina remains undefeated with a 7-0 overall record and 3-0 mark in the Southwest Wake Athletic Conference. The Bengals are tied with Middle Creek for first place in the conference. They will return to the filed on Oct. 9 with a home game against Apex. 
Holly Springs is now 4-3 overall and 2-1 in the conference. The Golden Hawks will host undefeated Middle Creek on Oct. 9.
